sn35.241:1.1: This appears to be a mistake, as Kosambī was in fact on the Yamunā river.
sn35.241:7.1: Nanda is one of the most common names in Pali, and it is not possible to identify this Nanda with any confidence. This episode stands as a reminder that the Buddha’s teachings were open, and many people from different backgrounds may have been listening, quite apart from the “mendicants” to whom the discourse is typically addressed. Note too that a man of such humble livelihood has no qualms in speaking directly to the Buddha.
